name: Roblox
notes: Security keys are currently only supported in web browsers and requires TOTP 2FA to be setup.

name: ING Bank Slaski [PL]
notes: The first security key requires confirmation at a bank branch.

name: Apple iCloud
notes: Passwordless authentication only works on Apple devices.

name: GoDaddy
notes: If hardware 2FA enabled, customer support by phone requires enabling back-up method.

name: Standard Notes
notes: Professional Subscription required to use security keys.

name: Skiff
notes: Security key MFA required TOTP to be enabled.

name: Apple
notes: Passwordless authentication only works on Apple devices.

name: Amazon
notes: Passkeys must be activated individually on different regional Amazon sites, such as UK and DE.

name: FusionAuth
notes: Requires Essentials or Enterprise plan

name: Fastmail
notes: Setup requires SMS verification.

name: University of Otago
notes: Security key MFA is only available to staff.

name: Okta
notes: Passkeys can only be set up on an Android, iOS or macOS device.

name: Mastodon
notes: TOTP must be enabled to use a security key.

name: Dropbox
notes: Software or SMS 2FA must be enabled for passkeys to be registered.

name: Vanguard
notes: Security key support requires a phone number as a backup.

name: Bitbucket
notes: An SSH key must be associated with your account to enable 2FA.

name: LastPass
notes: Security key MFA is available through Duo integration.

name: Yahoo!
notes: Linked phone number required for MFA.

name: PayPal
notes: An eligible Apple or Android device is required to create a passkey.

name: Perimeter 81
notes: Security key MFA is available through Duo integration.

name: PayFit
notes: TOTP or SMS must be used to set up passkeys.

name: Proton
notes: TOTP must be enabled to use a security key.

name: Wikipedia
notes: Currently limited to accounts with certain roles. See documentation for a full list.
